p: The first symptom of SARS is fever of 38°C (100.4°F) or higher, followed by nonspecific flu‐like symptoms such as chills/rigor, muscle aches and pain, headaches, diarrhea, sore throat, runny nose and malaise. The symptoms usually last about 2 to 7 days. Affected patients may develop a dry cough, shortness of breath, and pneumonia.
